response.job_title: Executive Director, Head of Client Coverage Colombia & Panama at Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation
response.summary: Corporate finance professional with well-rounded international banking experience. Skilled in Structured Lending, Acquisition Finance, Capital Markets, Credit Risk and Hedging. Enjoys working in diverse and versatile environments.
response.skills: Financial Modeling, Financial Analysis, Corporate Finance, Valuation, Banking, Capital Markets, Credit Risk, Due Diligence, Derivatives

profile_positions.title: Executive Director, Head of Client Coverage Colombia & Panama

profile_positions.description:
-Managed the Bank’s Power and Food & Beverage Corporate Banking portfolio in Colombia (worth USD 600 million in assets); responsible for client coverage, and portfolio growth and profitability.
-Advised on value adding financing solutions that contributed with clients’ strategic goals.
-Originated, structured and executed domestic and international syndicated loans worth USD 1 billion+, where Scotiabank acted as Joint or Sole Lead Arranger; some of these were acquisition financing transactions that funded important M&A initiatives in Colombia and other LatAm jurisdictions. 
-Achieved 90% loan portfolio growth (1.8x above budget) during last 9 months, demonstrating effective performance and consolidating the Bank´s Corporate Banking franchise in Colombia.
profile_positions.title: Director, Corporate Banking

profile_positions.description:
-Executed and structured new customized financing solutions worth USD 500 million+ for Corporate Banking clients in Colombia.
-Liaised with credit officers and client coverage teams to defend credit proposals, offer recommendations on transactions, and negotiate complex documents.  
-Teamed up for the creation of Banco Colpatria’s Corporate Banking Unit, and the implementation of Scotiabank’s credit and commercial guidelines. 
-Selected for and assigned to this role by Scotiabank Canada.
profile_positions.title: Associate Director, Credit Solutions

profile_positions.description:
-Responsible for the administration of a USD 3.0 billion LatAm Corporate Banking loan and derivatives portfolio. In charge of managing portfolio quality, monitoring credit and industry limits, and supervising adherence to credit and regulatory policies. 
-Performed effective analysis of financial models and credit applications, to assess borrowers’ repayment capacity and mitigate risks. Prepared succinct credit recommendations for senior management.  
- Facilitated adjudication and structuring of deals across LatAm’s 3 largest economies, covering various industries. 
-Liaised with client coverage teams to provide advice on policy issues and deal structure, and ensure alignment of transactions with Bank and market standards.
profile_positions.title: Manager, Global Risk Management LatAm

profile_positions.description:
-Articulated financial and strategic analysis, and applied valuation techniques for acquisition of an energy company in North America (EV      USD5 billion +).
-Narrowed original pool of 20 prospect companies to short-list of 3 targets, for Board of Directors’ final consideration. 
-Conducted research on attractiveness of natural gas industry and its alignment with Centrica’s corporate strategy.
profile_positions.title: Intern, Strategy and M&A

profile_positions.description:
-Key contributor to the deployment of a new corporate finance strategy, which consisted of the refinancing of a USD 500 million loan portfolio. This initiative eliminated headquarters’ guarantees before local lenders, aligned companies' debt profile with nature of their business, and reduced yearly financial expenses by 15%.
-Coordinated multi-disciplinary teams for the negotiation and execution of USD 150 million secondary stock offer and syndicated loans worth USD 350 million.  
-Minimized foreign exchange and interest rate risks through the evaluation of hedging instruments.
profile_positions.title: Manager, Corporate Finance

school.name: University of Toronto - Rotman School of Management

education.degree_name: BA in Economics with Minor in Finance

company.name: Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation
company.description:
Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group, Inc. (SMFG) is the holding company of SMBC Group, which is one of the three largest banking groups in Japan. In the Americas, we are more than 5,000 employees strong with a presence in the U.S., Canada, Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, and Peru. 

Built upon a foundation that leverages the perspective of more than 400 years of history, our Japanese heritage affirms a sense of honor and commitment that is increasingly rare in the financial world. Our deeply-held values of service, respect, and integrity are present in everything we do.   

Backed by the capital strength of SMBC Group and the value of its relationships in Asia, we offer a range of commercial and investment banking services to our corporate, institutional, and municipal clients. We connect a diverse client base to local markets and the organization’s extensive global network. The Group’s operating companies in the Americas include Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp. (SMBC), SMBC Nikko Securities America, Inc., SMBC Nikko Securities Canada, Ltd., SMBC Capital Markets, Inc., SMBC Rail Services LLC, Manufacturers Bank, JRI America, Inc., SMBC Leasing and Finance, Inc., Banco Sumitomo Mitsui Brasileiro S.A., and Sumitomo Mitsui Finance and Leasing Co., Ltd.

location.address: Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation 277 Park Avenue
